about.intro: Every line of code, every merge, every fix â€” your GitHub contributions might look like just numbers and green squares. But for developers, behind those squares are persistence, thinking, and growth. Green Wall is the stage built for these stories.
about.whyWeBuiltContent:
As developers, we're used to diving deep into code and issues, but rarely pause to truly reflect on the path we've walked.
You might have forgotten that late night when you solved a tricky bug, or that time when a PR was rejected and you refined it again.
But those accumulated moments shaped who you are today.
Green Wall wants to turn this "contribution wall" into your own growth chronicle â€” visible and worth sharing.
about.howItHelps: How it helps you tell your story
about.howItHelpsIntro: Green Wall isn't just an image generator. It transforms your scattered historical contributions on GitHub:
about.howItHelpsItem1: Into clear visualizations: Your footprints from every year, week, and day are visible at a glance.
about.howItHelpsItem2: With customizable sharing: You can choose themes, sizes, and styles to make the presentation fit your voice.
about.howItHelpsItem3: With meaning beyond the image: It can be a highlight in your README, or serve as proof of your work for job applications, showcases, and self-reflection.
about.inspirationContent:
This tool started with a simple thought:
"What if code contributions could be displayed like a painting â€” wouldn't that be more interesting?"
So it fetches your contribution data through GitHub's official API and turns it into a visual wall using modern web technology.
about.finalMessageContent:
Every line of code you write isn't just a commit â€” it's part of your story.
Green Wall exists to ensure these stories don't fade into history, but become marks you can be proud of.
Go generate your contribution wall and let others see the real you.
about.supportContent: If Green Wall makes your work feel a little more visible, you can support it by starring on <github>GitHub</github> or voting on <productHunt>Product Hunt</productHunt>. Sharing it with friends or adding it to your portfolio also helps a lot.
about.reportingIssuesContent: Found a bug, have a feature idea, or want the experience to feel smoother? Please leave a note on the <link>GitHub issues</link>. We read every piece of feedback.

error.title: Sign in failed
error.defaultMessage: Something went wrong during sign in. Please try again.
error.networkTimeout: Connection to GitHub timed out. Please check your network and try again.
error.networkError: Unable to connect to GitHub. Please check your network connection.
error.invalidCode: The authorization code has expired or is invalid. Please try signing in again.
error.accessDenied: You denied the authorization request. Sign in to unlock more features.
error.serverError: GitHub is temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.
error.configError: OAuth configuration error. Please contact the administrator.
